I had originally played Dead by Daylight on the Play Station before making the jump to PC.  Both are great versions of the game.  While I do think playing the game with a controller is much easier than playing it with a keyboard.  The mechanics are easy to learn and to easy to change.  I like that they add new killers that are both from horror mythos and developing new ones.

This game holds a special place in my heart. I love it. IT JUST WORKS.

(I also got it for my kids and they enjoy playing it with me, too)

Il gioco √® carino e diverte. Nota dolente √® che non si pu√≤ giocare in coop con amici e random

The tragedy of this game is that before the last update, the dynamic between the survivors and the killer was arguably the most balanced it has ever been. Then the devs, in their infinite wisdom, decided to enable survivors to heal themselves at a moment's notice using boon totems. This creates a scenario where the killer is forced to choose between chasing a survivor and potentially losing generators, or dropping the chase only for that survivor to heal themselves within 30 seconds after that. I'm always up for a challenge, but this makes playing as killer genuinely not fun, even more so when you're up against a well-coordinated swf. The overpowered nature of this gameplay addition shows that the devs are perfectly okay with arbitrarily alienating a large portion of their player base. With the influx of hackers, NFTs, and the newfound lack of anything remotely resembling balance, I can see this game eventually dying. It's a shame, because the game still has so much going for it. The only thing it's missing are developers who care as much as the community. See you soon, VHS.

as a killer main, Behaviour Interactive have found many ways to stack our decks with little rewards. now that Mikaela Reid has been released, i've renamed myself "HEX: WITCH TRIALS" to have fun, but then mikaela's perks have been tought to all the survivors and i cant stand the juggling of suvivors, perks, and now the BROKEN boon totems that have made my life a living hell. I've put through this game to thick and thin, but this is enough, this is the managing straw that broke my back,

death is not an escape. but an uninstall is, take care whoever is still playing, but to those who main the witch, remember, you are playing the reason that i left.

absolutely addicting the grind can be intimidating to new players but if you persevere you will be rewarded with a deep game play experience

Devs ignore community feedback, make fake promises to console players, overpriced skins and now linked cosmetics. It took these devs over a month to fix the no stun from pallets bug... a whole month for a game breaking bug is unacceptable. The meta just keeps getting worse and worse for killers and solo survivor's almost to the point that you have to be on a tournament level to win at high MMR. I started playing in 2018 on the PS4 and now l barely touch this game.
